intro: Cephaelis kaieteurensis, commonly known as the Kaieteurean celandine, is a flowering plant native to the Kaieteure region of Guyana. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers and lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
